Subjects: women, as speakers/narrators; complaints, lovers’; love, vicissitudes of
_description: Three couplets translating ‘Omnis amor clerici amor clerici’

Leicester4.Transcription:
Al clerkyn lou clercyn lowys ywyrt at oxinfort on ȝe scolows
                    dorȜef clerkyn lowe hawe y ne mayI may kys ȝe scoldor and
                    far myn wayAlas clerkyn lowe fal from meSo doth ȝe lef on grof ys
                    tre
Leicester4.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas. 
             “Anecdota Literaria: Scraps in English and Latin From A Manuscript of
                the Fourteenth Century, in the Library of the Corporation of Leicester.” 
             Retrospective Review
         1 (Aug., 1853): 419: 419.
